posts.post_content: He's not bad in Commander, if you can make use of the +1/+1 counter (like if you got creatures with persist or simply creatures that use +1/+1 for something) or if you have a commander with a significant power, so that double strike is making a huge difference. The ultimate ability you will never reach in Commander though.

posts.post_content: I finally got to play against this particular Planeswalker just the other day in Limited, and I have to agree with LSV that, while it seemingly has no method of defending itself, its self-preservation lies in its high starting loyalty that causes it to be difficult to outright kill with creatures. Granted, Limited and Standard/etc. are completely different beasts, but I could see this newest version making a splash in a White Weenie deck.

Posted By: BongRipper420 (10/9/2012 10:41:16 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
An interesting new incarnation of Ajani. He has no lifegain abilities of his own, though, which makes me sad. Old Ajani wall all about the pride uniting as one, and this guy has a +1/+1 for a single creature, an uberstrike for a single creature, and the ability to make an absolute mass of the buggers.  
  
Could be interesting with the return of Exalted, though. that -3 turns your champ into a game ending bolt of lightning.
posts.html:

Old Ajani wall all about the pride uniting as one, and this guy has a +1/+1 for a single creature, an uberstrike for a single creature, and the ability to make an absolute mass of the buggers.

Could be interesting with the return of Exalted, though. that -3 turns your champ into a game ending bolt of lightning.
